article.headline: Bucknell 76, Haverford 44
article.story: LEWISBURG, Pa. (AP) -- Jason Vegotsky scored 11 of his 14 points in the second half as Bucknell defeated Haverford 76-44 on Monday in a non-league contest. The Bison (7-1) posted a 32-10 scoring advantage after the break and used their size and athleticism to keep the Fords (3-5) from mounting a serious threat. They led 31-21 at the half despite turning the ball over 14 times. Chris McNaughton sparked an early 9-0 run with four points in the paint while Kevin Bettencourt added a 3-pointer. Haverford was unable to match the taller Bison players on the boards and soon found itself trailing 20-10. But 3-pointers by David Nowacki and Aaron Heath kept the visitors within striking distance at 29-19. The Bison went on a 22-6 run in the second half as McNaughton tallied 5 points and Vegotsky knocked down his second 3-pointer to push the advantage to 53-29. Bucknell shot 46 percent for the game and enjoyed a 51-27 edge on the boards. McNaughton posted 14 points and seven rebounds. Vegotsky also finished with 14 points, while Donald Brown had 10 points and 10 rebounds. Jason Polykoff and Mike Frantangelo each scored 8 points in a losing effort.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
